verses.text: And he commanded the steward of his house , saying , Fill the men’s sacks \add with\add* food , as much as they can carry , and put every man’s money in his sack’s mouth.\f + \fr 44.1 \ft the steward…: Heb. him that was over his house\f*
And put my cup , the silver cup , in the sack’s mouth of the youngest , and his corn money. And he did according to the word that Joseph had spoken.
As soon as the morning was light , the men were sent away , they and their asses.

\add And\add* when they were gone out of the city , \add and\add* not \add yet\add* far off , Joseph said unto his steward , Up , follow after the men ; and when thou dost overtake them, say unto them, Wherefore have ye rewarded evil for good ?
\add Is\add* not this \add it\add* in which my lord drinketh , and whereby indeed he divineth ? ye have done evil in so doing.\f + \fr 44.5 \ft divineth: or, maketh trial?\f* \p
¶ And he overtook them, and he spake unto them these same words.
And they said unto him, Wherefore saith my lord these words ? God forbid that thy servants should do according to this thing :
Behold, the money , which we found in our sacks’ mouths , we brought again unto thee out of the land of Canaan : how then should we steal out of thy lord’s house silver or gold ?
With whomsoever of thy servants it be found , both let him die , and we also will be my lord’s bondmen.
And he said , Now also \add let\add* it \add be\add* according unto your words : he with whom it is found shall be my servant ; and ye shall be blameless.
Then they speedily took down every man his sack to the ground , and opened every man his sack.
And he searched , \add and\add* began at the eldest , and left at the youngest : and the cup was found in Benjamin’s sack.
Then they rent their clothes , and laded every man his ass , and returned to the city. \p
¶ And Judah and his brethren came to Joseph’s house ; for he \add was\add* yet there: and they fell before him on the ground.
And Joseph said unto them, What deed \add is\add* this that ye have done ? wot ye not that such a man as I can certainly divine ?\f + \fr 44.15 \ft divine: or, make trial?\f*

And Judah said , What shall we say unto my lord ? what shall we speak ? or how shall we clear ourselves ? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants : behold, we \add are\add* my lord’s servants , both we, and \add he\add* also with whom the cup is found.
And he said , God forbid that I should do so : \add but\add* the man in whose hand the cup is found , he shall be my servant ; and as for you, get you up in peace unto your father. \p

¶ Then Judah came near unto him, and said , Oh my lord , let thy servant , I pray thee, speak a word in my lord’s ears , and let not thine anger burn against thy servant : for thou \add art\add* even as Pharaoh.
My lord asked his servants , saying , Have ye a father , or a brother ?
And we said unto my lord , We have a father , an old man , and a child of his old age , a little one ; and his brother is dead , and he alone is left of his mother , and his father loveth him.
And thou saidst unto thy servants , Bring him down unto me, that I may set mine eyes upon him.
And we said unto my lord , The lad cannot leave his father : for \add if\add* he should leave his father , \add his father\add* would die.
And thou saidst unto thy servants , Except your youngest brother come down with you, ye shall see my face no more.
And it came to pass when we came up unto thy servant my father , we told him the words of my lord.
And our father said , Go again , \add and\add* buy us a little food.
And we said , We cannot go down : if our youngest brother be with us, then will we go down : for we may not see the man’s face , except our youngest brother \add be\add* with us.
And thy servant my father said unto us, Ye know that my wife bare me two \add sons:\add*
And the one went out from me, and I said , Surely he is torn in pieces ; and I saw him not since :
And if ye take this also from me , and mischief befall him , ye shall bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.
Now therefore when I come to thy servant my father , and the lad \add be\add* not with us; seeing that his life is bound up in the lad’s life ;

It shall come to pass, when he seeth that the lad \add is\add* not \add with us\add*, that he will die : and thy servants shall bring down the gray hairs of thy servant our father with sorrow to the grave.
For thy servant became surety for the lad unto my father , saying , If I bring him not unto thee, then I shall bear the blame to my father for ever.
Now therefore, I pray thee, let thy servant abide instead of the lad a bondman to my lord ; and let the lad go up with his brethren.
For how shall I go up to my father , and the lad \add be\add* not with me? lest peradventure I see the evil that shall come on my father.\f + \fr 44.34 \ft come…: Heb. find my father\f*
